result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald F. Dagen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two.
No contact with C.M. or her family.

Complete any assessment, treatment, and counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 
Complete SAFE program intake and mental health assessment w/ follow through.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald F. Dagen

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 8:46am
INCLUDES 15CM1856, 15CM2091, 16CM269
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Paul Goetz
Date and time set for restitution hearing

State is ready to procced with testimony
C.M. is sworn in and testifies- identifies defendant
Atty Goetz makes argument on restitution being requested by victim
State says restitution victim is requesting should have been in 13CF19 which previously had plea hearing on 06/02/14 with Judge Moran
COURT states restitution request is not in these three current files before court today; restitution amount of $2300 that victim is requesting is in 13CF19 and this Court does not have jurisdication over 13CF19 due to another court presiding over this case previously
COURT does not order restitution in either three files - 15CM1856, 15CM2091, 16CM269

Restitution hearing on June 13, 2016 at 08:45 am.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 3:17pm
INCLUDES 15CM1856, 15CM2091, 16CM269
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke;  Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty Paul Goetz
 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
15CM2091:
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping- misdemeanor- repeater >> D&RI
16CM269:
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping- misdemeanor- repeater >> D&RI
COURT grants above
PLEA: 
15CM1856:
Ct. 1 Knowingly violate domestic abuse order- repeater >> NO CONTEST
15CM2091:
Ct. 1 Criminal damage to Property- repeater >> NO CONTEST
16CM269:
Ct. 1 Bail jumping- misdemeanor- repeater >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
C.M. makes victim impact statement to court
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 24 months probation on each count, concurrent. CONDITIONS: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Complete SAFE program intake and mental health assessment with follow through. No contact with victim- C.M. or her family. Restitution was requested by victim of $2,300.00, however separate hearing to address restitution will need to be set. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. If revoked, zero days credit. 

Defendant makes argument on restitution amount
Restitution hearing to be scheduled with Br 1 JA. 

Adj: 3:46pm
Plea hearing on April 20, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Atty Goetz did not appear at CC on 2/15/16. Set FPT 3/8/16 @ 1:50pm

Final pre-trial at 02-22-2016 03:30 pm.
Jury Trial at 03-23-2016 08:30 am.

Shall not consume alcohol.  No contact with victim(s): Super 8 Motel-Wausau.
